intro: Schultesia benthamiana, commonly known as the Bentham's schultesia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Schultesia benthamiana is primarily of interest to botanists and horticulturists due to its ornamental value and unique floral structure.
